case_title: REHMAT KHAN vs KHUSHI MUHAMMAD AND ANOTHER

judgment_summary.background: On the death of Zain Khan, Lambardar of Chak No. 97/W.B., Tehsil Vehari, the A.C./Collector, Vehari appointed Rehmat Khan as successor Lambardar based on ownership of 12i acres and belonging to the majority community.
judgment_summary.commissioner_decision: The learned Commissioner, Multan set aside the A.C./Collector's decision and remanded the case for fresh determination under rule 19(1) of the Land Revenue Rules.
judgment_summary.appeal_arguments: Rehmat Khan's counsel presented verified statements showing 952 acres out of 1155 acres under proprietary holding and established that Zain Khan was a permanent Lambardar.
judgment_summary.court_decision: Considering the proprietary nature of the Chak and the prior claim of Rehmat Khan based on primogeniture, the appeal was accepted, and Rehmat Khan was appointed Lambardar of Chak No. 97/W.B.
